class.name: GodotIKEffector
class.brief_description: Defines the target for an IK chain's end effector.
class.description: GodotIKEffector represents the target position and orientation for the terminal bone in an IK chain. It allows developers to specify which bone should be controlled by the IK solver, adjust how many bones are affected, and configure the behavior of the chain's end. By setting the chain length and leaf behavior, you can fine-tune the balance between preserving existing transforms and applying full IK corrections. Additionally, [GodotIKConstraint]s are supported, which are child nodes to [GodotIKEffector]s.

members.member: The index of the bone that this effector controls within the skeleton.
The number of bones in the IK chain that are influenced by this effector. A larger chain length will affect more bones during IK solving.

constants.constant: Only updates the target bone's position while preserving its original rotation and scale.
Applies the effector's position, but preserves the bone’s local rotation and scale.
Positions the target bone and then straightens the chain by adjusting the rotation relative to the parent bone.
Applies the complete transform of the IKEffector node—position, rotation, and scale—to the target bone.
